q: The fastest way to change is to laugh at your own folly.
h:
“The fastest way to change is to laugh at your own folly.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
h:
“Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.” —
Carl Jung

q: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
h:
“There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
h:
“A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.” —
Charles Darwin

q: You're never too old for anything.
h:
“You're never too old for anything.” —
Betty White

q: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
h:
“You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Your problem isn't the problem. Your reaction is the problem.
h:
“Your problem isn't the problem. Your reaction is the problem.” —
Unknown

q: Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.
h:
“Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.” —
Richard Bach

q: The real art in learning takes place as we move beyond proficiency, when our work becomes an expression of our essence.
h:
“The real art in learning takes place as we move beyond proficiency, when our work becomes an expression of our essence.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.
h:
“We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: To be truly ignorant, be content with your own knowledge.
h:
“To be truly ignorant, be content with your own knowledge.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
h:
“Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.” —
Carl Bard

q: A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.
h:
“A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.
h:
“There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.” —
Albert Einstein

q: There are no accidents... there is only some purpose that we haven't yet understood.
h:
“There are no accidents... there is only some purpose that we haven't yet understood.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: It's not the love you make. It's the love you give.
h:
“It's not the love you make. It's the love you give. ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: Short cuts make long delays.
h:
“Short cuts make long delays.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: The only reason to be alive is to enjoy it.
h:
“The only reason to be alive is to enjoy it.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.
h:
“The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: The wisest men follow their own direction.
h:
“The wisest men follow their own direction.” —
Euripides

q: So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.
h:
“So long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Circumstances do not make the man, they reveal him.
h:
“Circumstances do not make the man, they reveal him.” —
James Allen

q: Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.
h:
“Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: Our stories may be singular, but our destination is shared.
h:
“Our stories may be singular, but our destination is shared.” —
Barack Obama

q: Make your mind your own business.
h:
“Make your mind your own business.” —
Jack Butcher

q: The best answer to anger is silence.
h:
“The best answer to anger is silence.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
h:
“Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: A thing must be loved before it is lovable.
h:
“A thing must be loved before it is lovable.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Never do to others what you would not like them to do to you.
h:
“Never do to others what you would not like them to do to you. ” —
Confucius

q: Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.
h:
“Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.” —
John Wooden

q: You can have the mind or you can have the moment.
h:
“You can have the mind or you can have the moment.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Constantly think about how you could be doing things better.
h:
“Constantly think about how you could be doing things better.” —
Elon Musk

q: If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.
h:
“If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself
h:
“When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Stop wasting time defending your problems and work on addressing them instead.
h:
“Stop wasting time defending your problems and work on addressing them instead.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
h:
“Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: You have as much laughter as you have faith.
h:
“You have as much laughter as you have faith.” —
Martin Luther

q: We must not cease from exploration. And the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we began and to know the place for the first time.
h:
“We must not cease from exploration. And the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we began and to know the place for the first time.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Ancient Rule of Twenty-one: if you do anything for twenty-one days in a row, it will be installed as a habit.
h:
“Ancient Rule of Twenty-one: if you do anything for twenty-one days in a row, it will be installed as a habit.” —
Robin Sharma

q: One of the really tough things is figuring out what questions to ask. Once you figure out the question, then the answer is relatively easy.
h:
“One of the really tough things is figuring out what questions to ask. Once you figure out the question, then the answer is relatively easy.” —
Elon Musk

q: Always render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what your task may be.
h:
“Always render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what your task may be.” —
Og Mandino

q: Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.
h:
“Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: If you are unable to find the truth right where you are, where else do you expect to find it?
h:
“If you are unable to find the truth right where you are, where else do you expect to find it?” —
Dogen

q: Never say never, because limits, like fears, are often just an illusion.
h:
“Never say never, because limits, like fears, are often just an illusion.” —
Michael Jordan

q: We become what we believe.
h:
“We become what we believe.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.
h:
“Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.” —
Bob Marley

q: All leaders are readers.
h:
“All leaders are readers.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Little minds have little worries, big minds have no time for worries.
h:
“Little minds have little worries, big minds have no time for worries.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Learn to use your emotions to think, not think with your emotions.
h:
“Learn to use your emotions to think, not think with your emotions.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
h:
“Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.” —
Roy T. Bennett
